--- source: https://developer.apple.com/documentation/Swift/Int/init(bitPattern:)-2i0qy crawled: 2025-12-02T20:31:15Z --- # init(bitPattern:) **Initializer** Creates a new value with the bit pattern of the given pointer. ## Declaration ```swift init

(bitPattern pointer: P?) where P : _Pointer ``` ## Parameters - **pointer**: The pointer to use as the source for the new integer. ## Discussion The new value represents the address of the pointer passed as `pointer`. If `pointer` is `nil`, the result is `0`. ## Working with Memory Addresses - **init(bitPattern:)**: Creates an integer that captures the full value of the given object identifier. - **init(bitPattern:)**: Creates a new value with the bit pattern of the given pointer.
